abstract: PicLens makes viewing photos on your computer screen a 3-D experience.
snippet: PicLens makes viewing photos on your computer screen a 3-D experience.
lead_paragraph: PicLens makes viewing photos on your computer screen a 3-D experience. You can do a Google search for a particular image, and a wall of images floats across your screen. You pull the stream of photos across the screen as if you were Tom Cruise in “Minority Report.” PicLens, a Web browser add-on, displays photos from Flickr, Facebook, MySpace and Yahoo Images, too. Best of all, PicLens is free at www.cooliris.com and works on PCs and Macs with Internet Explorer, Firefox or Safari browsers. And it takes less than a minute to download and install.

headline.main: Tip of the Week: Viewing Images in 3-D

abstract: European regulators are preparing to approve Google’s proposed acquisition of DoubleClick, according to wire reports. The delay was caused by complaints from Microsoft, which may not look so important now that the company is trying to buy Yahoo.
snippet: European regulators are preparing to approve Google’s proposed acquisition of DoubleClick, according to wire reports. The delay was caused by complaints from Microsoft, which may not look so important now that the company is trying to buy Yahoo.
lead_paragraph: Google’s year in the penalty box may be over.

headline.main: Will Europe Let Google Out of the Penalty Box?
